commit.message: Replace 3.1.0 in the 'About this release' page

nodes.bodyText: The indentation of this is incorrect.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -20,11 +20,11 @@ If you want to see the APIs grouped according to different topics in the Develop
     1.  Go to the API Publisher ( `https://<HostName>:9443/publisher` ).
     2.  Click on the respective API and go to `Design Configurations`.
     [ ![]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/categorizing-and-grouping-apis-publisher.png) ]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/categorizing-and-grouping-apis-publisher.png)

@@ -20,11 +20,11 @@ If you want to see the APIs grouped according to different topics in the Develop
     1.  Go to the API Publisher ( `https://<HostName>:9443/publisher` ).
     2.  Click on the respective API and go to `Design Configurations`.
     [ ![]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/categorizing-and-grouping-apis-publisher.png) ]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/categorizing-and-grouping-apis-publisher.png)
-    3.  Add a group name to the APIs that you wish to group.
+    1.  Add a group name to the APIs that you wish to group.

@@ -20,11 +20,11 @@ If you want to see the APIs grouped according to different topics in the Develop
     1.  Go to the API Publisher ( `https://<HostName>:9443/publisher` ).
     2.  Click on the respective API and go to `Design Configurations`.
     [ ![]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/categorizing-and-grouping-apis-publisher.png) ]({{base_path}}/assets/img/learn/categorizing-and-grouping-apis-publisher.png)
-    3.  Add a group name to the APIs that you wish to group.
+    1.  Add a group name to the APIs that you wish to group.
 
         For example add the "Technology-group".
 
-    4.  Save the API for the tag to appear in the Devloper Portal.
+    2.  Save the API for the tag to appear in the Devloper Portal.

nodes.bodyText: As you have changed this to point to the REST API getting started guide. You need to change the other links to the getting started link as well. Currently. some still point to the REST APIs page directly
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -6,8 +6,8 @@ There are two versions of REST APIs available for the API Publisher and Develope
- -
WSO2 Publisher v1WSO2 recommends that you use the v1 REST APIs as it is up to date and has support for the latest WSO2 API Manager 3.1.0 features with regard to the Publisher and the Developer Portal. + WSO2 Publisher v1

@@ -5,21 +5,22 @@ Please follow below steps to configure the prepackaged WSO2 Identity Server as t
 !!! warning
